definition[0]: used between two nouns to show that something has two purposes
definition[1]: when the price of shares is listed cum dividend or cum div, the person who buys them will receive the next DIVIDEND payment on them
example[2]: We can claim any trading losses made by buying stock cum dividend and then selling it ex-dividend against our tax liability.
definition[2]: when a bond, security etc is cum interest, interest will paid on a particular date in the future, and this amount is included in its trading price
